title: Evolution of AI: From Neural Networks to Claude Code

text.headline: Perceptron Invented
text.text: Frank Rosenblatt develops the Perceptron, the first artificial neural network capable of learning through supervised training.

events.notes: The Perceptron laid the groundwork for modern neural networks, introducing the concept of weighted connections and learning from examples.

text.headline: Backpropagation Popularized
text.text: Rumelhart, Hinton, and Williams publish groundbreaking paper on backpropagation algorithm for training multi-layer neural networks.

events.notes: Backpropagation became the fundamental algorithm for training deep neural networks, enabling the modern AI revolution.

text.headline: LSTM Networks Introduced
text.text: Sepp Hochreiter and JÃ¼rgen Schmidhuber introduce Long Short-Term Memory networks to solve the vanishing gradient problem.

events.notes: LSTMs enabled neural networks to learn long-term dependencies, crucial for language modeling and sequence prediction.

text.headline: Deep Learning Revival
text.text: Geoffrey Hinton publishes papers on deep belief networks, sparking renewed interest in deep learning.

events.notes: Hinton's work demonstrated that deep networks could be effectively trained, launching the modern deep learning era.

text.headline: ImageNet Dataset Released
text.text: Fei-Fei Li's team releases ImageNet, a massive visual database with millions of labeled images for computer vision research.

events.notes: ImageNet became the benchmark dataset that drove computer vision advances and the deep learning revolution.

text.headline: AlexNet Wins ImageNet
text.text: Alex Krizhevsky's AlexNet wins ImageNet competition by large margin, proving deep learning's superiority in computer vision.

events.notes: AlexNet's victory marked the beginning of deep learning dominance in AI, demonstrating the power of deep convolutional networks and GPUs.

text.headline: Word2Vec Released
text.text: Google researchers release Word2Vec, enabling efficient learning of word embeddings that capture semantic relationships.

events.notes: Word2Vec revolutionized NLP by representing words as dense vectors, enabling machines to understand semantic similarity.

text.headline: GANs Introduced
text.text: Ian Goodfellow introduces Generative Adversarial Networks, enabling realistic synthetic data generation.

events.notes: GANs pioneered adversarial training and became foundational for generative AI, including image and text generation.

text.headline: Sequence-to-Sequence Learning
text.text: Google researchers introduce seq2seq models with attention, revolutionizing machine translation and text generation.

events.notes: Seq2seq models with attention mechanisms paved the way for modern language models and transformers.

text.headline: ResNet Architecture
text.text: Microsoft Research introduces Residual Networks (ResNet), enabling training of networks with 100+ layers.

events.notes: ResNet's skip connections solved the degradation problem, enabling much deeper and more powerful neural networks.

text.headline: AlphaGo Defeats Lee Sedol
text.text: DeepMind's AlphaGo defeats world champion Lee Sedol in Go, demonstrating AI's strategic reasoning capabilities.

events.notes: AlphaGo's victory showcased reinforcement learning and Monte Carlo tree search, expanding AI beyond pattern recognition.

text.headline: Attention Is All You Need
text.text: Google researchers publish the Transformer paper, introducing self-attention mechanism that replaced recurrent architectures.

events.notes: The Transformer architecture became the foundation for all modern large language models, enabling parallel processing and long-range dependencies.

text.headline: GPT-1 Released
text.text: OpenAI releases the first Generative Pre-trained Transformer, demonstrating the power of unsupervised pre-training.

events.notes: GPT-1 introduced the pre-training then fine-tuning paradigm that became standard for language models.

text.headline: BERT Published
text.text: Google AI releases BERT, introducing bidirectional pre-training and achieving state-of-the-art on 11 NLP tasks.

events.notes: BERT's masked language modeling and bidirectional context understanding set new benchmarks across natural language understanding tasks.

text.headline: GPT-2 Released
text.text: OpenAI releases GPT-2 (1.5B parameters), initially withholding full model due to safety concerns about text generation.

events.notes: GPT-2 demonstrated impressive zero-shot learning and coherent long-form text generation, raising awareness of AI safety issues.

text.headline: RoBERTa Improvements
text.text: Facebook AI releases RoBERTa, showing that BERT was significantly undertrained and achieving better performance.

events.notes: RoBERTa demonstrated the importance of training procedures and data quality in language model performance.

text.headline: T5 Model Released
text.text: Google introduces Text-to-Text Transfer Transformer (T5), unifying all NLP tasks as text generation problems.

events.notes: T5's unified text-to-text framework simplified NLP and influenced future model architectures including instruction-tuned models.

text.headline: DistilBERT Released
text.text: Hugging Face releases DistilBERT, demonstrating effective model distillation while retaining 97% of BERT's performance.

events.notes: DistilBERT pioneered model compression techniques essential for deploying large models in production environments.

text.headline: GPT-3 Paper Published
text.text: OpenAI publishes GPT-3 paper with 175B parameters, demonstrating remarkable few-shot learning capabilities.

events.notes: GPT-3's scale and in-context learning abilities marked a paradigm shift, showing that language models could perform tasks with minimal examples.

text.headline: GPT-3 API Launch
text.text: OpenAI launches GPT-3 API, making large language models accessible to developers for the first time.

events.notes: The GPT-3 API democratized access to powerful language models, enabling thousands of AI applications.

text.headline: DALL-E Introduced
text.text: OpenAI introduces DALL-E, demonstrating text-to-image generation using transformer architectures.

events.notes: DALL-E extended transformer capabilities to multimodal generation, opening new possibilities for creative AI applications.

text.headline: CLIP Released
text.text: OpenAI releases CLIP, learning visual concepts from natural language descriptions at scale.

events.notes: CLIP's vision-language alignment enabled zero-shot image classification and became foundational for multimodal AI.

text.headline: GitHub Copilot Announced
text.text: GitHub and OpenAI announce Copilot, an AI pair programmer powered by OpenAI Codex based on GPT-3.

events.notes: Copilot was the first mainstream AI coding assistant, demonstrating LLMs' practical utility for software development.

text.headline: Anthropic Founded
text.text: Dario Amodei, Daniela Amodei, and other former OpenAI researchers found Anthropic to build safe, beneficial AI systems.

events.notes: Anthropic was founded with a focus on AI safety research and developing Constitutional AI approaches for alignment.

text.headline: Codex Powers Copilot
text.text: OpenAI releases details on Codex, a GPT model fine-tuned on code that powers GitHub Copilot.

events.notes: Codex demonstrated that language models could understand and generate code across multiple programming languages.

text.headline: InstructGPT and RLHF
text.text: OpenAI releases InstructGPT paper, introducing Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) for better alignment.

events.notes: RLHF became the foundational technique for aligning language models with human preferences, directly enabling ChatGPT and modern AI assistants.

text.headline: Constitutional AI Paper
text.text: Anthropic publishes research on Constitutional AI, a method for training helpful, harmless, and honest AI systems.

events.notes: Constitutional AI introduced a novel approach to AI alignment using AI feedback guided by principles rather than human feedback alone.

text.headline: Stable Diffusion Released
text.text: Stability AI releases Stable Diffusion, an open-source text-to-image model that democratizes generative AI.

events.notes: Stable Diffusion's open release accelerated research and applications in generative AI and multimodal models.

text.headline: ChatGPT Launched
text.text: OpenAI launches ChatGPT, bringing conversational AI to mainstream users and achieving 1 million users in 5 days.

events.notes: ChatGPT's launch marked the mainstream breakthrough of AI assistants, fundamentally changing public perception of AI capabilities.

text.headline: ChatGPT Reaches 1M Users
text.text: ChatGPT achieves fastest user growth in history, demonstrating massive public demand for AI assistants.

events.notes: The explosive adoption validated the product-market fit for conversational AI and accelerated industry investment.

text.headline: LLaMA Models Released
text.text: Meta releases LLaMA, a collection of foundation language models from 7B to 65B parameters for research.

events.notes: LLaMA accelerated open-source LLM development and enabled research on efficient language models.

text.headline: GPT-4 Released
text.text: OpenAI releases GPT-4, introducing multimodal capabilities and significantly improved reasoning abilities.

events.notes: GPT-4 demonstrated major advances in complex reasoning, coding, and creative tasks while accepting image inputs.

text.headline: Claude Launched
text.text: Anthropic launches Claude, an AI assistant trained using Constitutional AI principles for safety and helpfulness.

events.notes: Claude's launch introduced a safety-focused alternative to existing LLMs, emphasizing harmlessness alongside capability.

text.headline: Claude Pro Released
text.text: Anthropic launches Claude Pro subscription, offering priority access and increased usage limits.

events.notes: Claude Pro enabled power users to leverage Claude for professional work and complex tasks.

text.headline: Claude 2 Released
text.text: Anthropic releases Claude 2 with improved performance, longer context window (100K tokens), and coding capabilities.

events.notes: Claude 2's 100K context window enabled processing entire codebases and long documents, a major advancement for practical applications.

text.headline: LLaMA 2 Released
text.text: Meta releases LLaMA 2 with commercial license, advancing open-source language model development.

events.notes: LLaMA 2's open commercial license enabled widespread deployment and customization of powerful language models.

text.headline: Claude 2.1 Released
text.text: Anthropic releases Claude 2.1 with 200K token context window and improved accuracy on long documents.

events.notes: The 200K context window enabled processing multiple books simultaneously, pushing boundaries of language model memory.

text.headline: Claude 3 Family Released
text.text: Anthropic launches Claude 3 family (Haiku, Sonnet, Opus) with vision capabilities and industry-leading performance.

events.notes: Claude 3 introduced multimodal understanding and a model family approach, with Opus achieving state-of-the-art on multiple benchmarks.

text.headline: GPT-4o Announced
text.text: OpenAI announces GPT-4o, offering GPT-4 level intelligence with improved speed and multimodal capabilities.

events.notes: GPT-4o demonstrated real-time voice conversation and enhanced vision, advancing multimodal AI interactions.

text.headline: Claude 3.5 Sonnet Released
text.text: Anthropic releases Claude 3.5 Sonnet, outperforming Claude 3 Opus while being faster and more cost-effective.

events.notes: Claude 3.5 Sonnet achieved best-in-class performance on coding tasks and graduate-level reasoning.

text.headline: Claude Artifacts Introduced
text.text: Anthropic introduces Artifacts feature, enabling Claude to create interactive content and visualizations in a dedicated workspace.

events.notes: Artifacts expanded Claude's capabilities beyond text to creating executable code, diagrams, and interactive applications.

text.headline: Computer Use Beta
text.text: Anthropic releases computer use capability in beta, allowing Claude to interact with computer interfaces.

events.notes: Computer use enabled Claude to control computers through screenshots and keyboard/mouse actions, a significant step toward agentic AI.

text.headline: Claude Desktop App Released
text.text: Anthropic launches Claude desktop application for macOS and Windows with local file access.

events.notes: The desktop app brought Claude closer to developers' workflows with native integrations and file system access.

text.headline: Extended Thinking Introduced
text.text: Anthropic introduces extended thinking mode, allowing Claude to reason through complex problems with explicit thinking steps.

events.notes: Extended thinking enhanced Claude's ability to solve complex multi-step problems by making reasoning process visible and verifiable.

text.headline: Claude Code Announced
text.text: Anthropic announces Claude Code, an official CLI tool for software development with terminal integration and tool use.

events.notes: Claude Code brought AI assistance directly into developers' terminals, integrating with git, package managers, and development workflows.

text.headline: MCP Protocol Released
text.text: Anthropic releases Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling Claude to connect to external data sources and tools.

events.notes: MCP standardized how AI assistants connect to enterprise systems, databases, and APIs, enabling context-aware assistance.

text.headline: Claude Skills Framework
text.text: Community develops Claude Skills framework, enabling autonomous agents for specialized educational content creation.

events.notes: The Skills framework extended Claude's capabilities with domain-specific workflows for textbook generation, learning graphs, and interactive simulations.

text.headline: Learning Graph Generator
text.text: First educational skill released: learning-graph-generator for creating concept dependency graphs with 200+ concepts.

events.notes: The learning graph generator automated creation of educational content structures following Bloom's Taxonomy and ISO 11179 standards.

text.headline: MicroSim Skills Released
text.text: Interactive visualization skills released: microsim-p5, venn-diagram-generator, and timeline-generator.

events.notes: MicroSim skills enabled automated creation of p5.js simulations and interactive visualizations for educational content.

text.headline: Timeline Generator Skill
text.text: This skill developed to create interactive historical timelines using vis-timeline.js library with category filtering.

events.notes: The timeline-generator skill completes the visualization toolkit, enabling chronological presentation of historical events and project milestones.

text.headline: Claude Code Released
text.text: Anthropic officially releases Claude Code 1.0, bringing production-ready AI pair programming to developers worldwide.

events.notes: Claude Code's official release marked the maturation of AI-assisted development tools, offering terminal integration, MCP support, and autonomous coding capabilities for professional software development.

text.headline: Claude Skills Announcement
text.text: Anthropic officially announces Claude Skills, enabling users to extend Claude's capabilities with custom autonomous agents and specialized workflows.

events.notes: Claude Skills formalized the extension framework, allowing developers to create specialized agents for domain-specific tasks, educational content generation, and workflow automation.
